subject: Investing
title: How a Stock Exchange Works
description: A 60-second lesson on How a Stock Exchange Works.

hook.text: The New York Stock Exchange matches millions of buyers and sellers every second. No shouting required anymore.

buildup.text: An exchange is a marketplace with rules. It ensures fair pricing, transparency, and order execution.

discovery.text: Electronic matching engines replaced floor traders. Today, most trades happen in microseconds via computers.

twist.text: There are over 60 stock exchanges globally. Tokyo, London, and Shanghai each handle trillions yearly.

climax.text: Dark pools let institutions trade privately to avoid moving prices. About 40% of US trades happen there.

punchline.text: An exchange is a referee. It doesn't play, but the game can't happen without it.

quiz.question: What percentage of US stock trades happen in dark pools?
